document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide Grade 6

56987412BF12428B85371889AB773B1E.description: Write for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences

27AC5598FDC542C8894AE907D3378814.description: Write for various tasks, purposes, and audiences for short or extended time frames

60E2E4CD4AA840AA93286925C97B959C.description: Determine appropriate organizational structure for various writing

3240819BCF5047BAB52A8E8CAA093D86.description: Determine when to write for short or extended time frames

56A5BF21DC0645BF9DE166E84F1BBD28.description: Identify and understand the various organizational structures

E8DE9FF8DD644967870FE2F4DE8865FC.description: Identify task, purpose, and audience for various types of writing

970D1201633E44BA8EAAA92876C205E9.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

C2D7586D9012437B80543E0128E75AAF.description: Reflect on key ideas and details as evidence of understanding text

3DEC9BBCF2BA48438AE25D9AB48943F8.description: Analyze key ideas and details as evidence of understanding text

A48CD24B1E994DB4A281754B25DE5FCC.description: Draw evidence as support for research

63FC836EBC61404594E7DF9D07498727.description: Cite textual evidence to analyze explicit text

AA7DCE82C1AC4C19A25513421D835BA5.description: Identify key ideas and details to support conclusions

58BED5F289B24D048BF5223C6F24894E.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

A2666F2D7BC4465D911BE33D3A430F87.description: Paraphrase and credit sources to avoid plagiarism

49D0BC1005CE48B1B65C17E3E21F50C9.description: Assess the credibility of each source

5343F18255A8446C841B2C88DC43EE92.description: Summarize information from print and digital sources

3D902F6BB0144167A21E2238EA0D266F.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

35595A8581064083B2EF7D2DF3D16F76.description: Conduct a short research project to answer a question

915627B63267412CBF4C37F9BE031C70.description: Narrow/refocus the inquiry by selecting information from multiple sources

5BCE5441ADD24BE89E5C432D38085CE5.description: Evaluate sources to answer a research question

FF2FE42007E24980B1FAF805524CE1BA.description: Select multiple resources to conduct short research projects

4F9CD780B28F47C4B0CD55C99F5FDD9D.description: Select appropriate research and inquiry methods

470FAB03F6BC4A559DDC90A0D8921925.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

444FF80A17244279AD9A05E8E9606331.description: Use keyboarding skills to type at least three pages in a single sitting

045E61C790CC40EC9F664F4FE6DDFEC4.description: Evaluate technology tools for collaborating, producing, and publishing writing

2D3566D4B4DD4C96A41E7D50B1573EDF.description: Evaluate technology tools for collaborating, producing, and publishing writing

DBA8870E435E47FF82632EEA733550FD.description: Select tools for communicating and collaborating

AC7EBC85F5404E62A57707208ABE9D24.description: Know how to download, save, upload, and attach documents

F38B7ED85599409CA6DD6EB7E7708999.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

D4ABB316F43145FF8F6A8716AF7A741B.description: Develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or typing a new approachc

C193324242FA4FDFA507D3389F60CE7D.description: Know how to edit for conventions

EA8FA4FD67424AE6B4FAF34702DFE655.description: Recognize how to plan, revise, edit, rewrite, and try a new approach

85B7FAD1567942A4A2DA59274658C3A4.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

A3DD6FE91E18412C995E3B10E8595375.description: Produce clear and coherent writing with idea development, organization, and style

C33BAA97ECDC420189243D65F6218879.description: Determine suitable idea development, organization and style strategies

4D4C50D2F65B4FD68A0C5FBE8D29CA72.description: Analyze the reason for writing to decide on task, purpose, or audience

1FE25A61CB554031BD9652023C1D5996.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

D128C06835DE4877B2EA7050B8BE2790.description: Write a narrative that uses precise, descriptive sensory language

7BE818C12FBE43AB817DF1178CA01770.description: Write a narrative that uses transitions to convey sequence and signal shifts

FB42E40BF7954A47B7E2754055F51284.description: Write a narrative that uses dialogue and description to develop experiences, events, and characters

E6351D369C80479EA0EE79813D398403.description: Write a narrative that engages and establishes a context and provides a conclusion

93F4521A33454E40AC6EDB27C0AFE138.description: Use precise words, details, and language to develop experiences and events

DFB14DF2C9704F78A3E4B5F1B8CF6CB8.description: Recognize how writers use transitional words to signal change

44123F1E41144AF780362210565789EF.description: Recognize the characteristics of a narrative

40279ABAF544484B949755B2153367C3.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

7B56DFF2E90E4EB3A32BA6D94D40CDC6.description: Use transitions to clarify the relationships between ideas and concepts

Introduce, organize and develop a topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, examples,
and other information

0C151745C6DA4A448A768253641E1332.description: Write with text selection, organization, and analysis in mind

49B181B1A00640E3BB2ABEC7CCC3CFCB.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information, maintaining
a formal style and providing a concluding statement or section

BA2210E5548844B5909B8C8D46F4FBC4.description: Use appropriate eye contact, volume, and clear pronunciation

9227B2A7103246C7ABA5DAA381723A0B.description: Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

585CA0D9C2B34CEDA891C0F885F21C5C.description: Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify understanding

2834623E76964201B614669695467AE8.description: Carry out assigned roles during discussion

696BD8E8BCE94A88B301F2365DBACD76.description: Collaborate to set goals and deadlines

B2B378694029439693CE33334DA7547B.description: Define individual roles for particular discussions

5460B36BCB56468C994C45ADD1A6F7EB.description: Reflect on discussion topics using evidence

1E88D437FFF84F148F20DE99222E4C87.description: Identify components of a collegial discussion and planning

2B5E39F6C1C34BA0A9B949370A0BA6DA.description: Identify key ideas from reading material

6C4BF33CE76B40FEBD2D0533726119E1.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

2FA6FA1D42614E55BD4E2E76FA26C85E.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

C9BC70D9D2974B9D89794B17ABF83E09.description: Compare and contrast how stories of the same genre approach a similar theme and topic

3AF62657E1C847A599437EB2998AF4AA.description: Analyze how stories of different genre approach a similar theme and topic

C818C61465C84147BDA586E8DFD2A1CA.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

8E7B0395772646DCA234CF006BA06576.description: Contrast what is seen/heard in a text when visually/auditory presented to what is experienced when read

D89FC092448F40AC940A176516EBC9DD.description: Evaluate the value of multiple text formats: text, audio, visual, live performance

EFB7436AA62748C48A9F21DE770FD937.description: Recognize the difference of multiple text formats: text, audio, visual, live performance

557F9976569D45298CCEB98262A07EF9.description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they "see" and "hear" when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

2C07AEDE4EAA4B69A3265B5736327D84.description: Recognize author’s strategies to develop point of view

E18D4EBCC3E24C97BD300FBF0DE7C03B.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

EFEB40A233C4422A86F7DE5A1438C3BD.description: Analyze how particular structure contributes to development of theme, setting, and plot

BD4EB14EE9264F46BB307C321CE97404.description: Analyze how a sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text

80EF767891A3470C8A4F9F627E9568DF.description: Recognize the theme, setting, and plot

A45B8C96FF83488B9DFEFFC32B816403.description: Define the various structures of a literacy text

BD643530945F4C26B61CA8180E5F5130.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

5F92994EE7294028BBAA61DFD00E88D5.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

1215D542F1B64F4581BBC069E7F5D894.description: Analyze how character(s) respond or change towards resolution

E29D502B65B44BB9A0D24AD954E2C949.description: Distinguish between textual facts and personal opinions or judgments

E17588961A6441B8B6405A64367F15ED.description: Analyze supporting details of a text

AE448DA9F8104FCFBC21CA9D1BFCC85B.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

04FAC528D2BE4457AB5A39459646E87C.description: Comprehend key ideas, details, craft, structure, and integration of knowledge

362826C9E5424B3CA50E6F28875DAD02.description: Identify key ideas, details, craft, structure, and integration of knowledge

F0BDD5A131AA497DAE1260F93369E31C.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

83E536AEB4C64645A12213FE97569016.description: Compare/contrast the events depicted by different authors

99D6CB7788794D8D8B2493208CB627E9.description: Identify events common in two or more texts
